data.meta_description: As we prepare to welcome back employees to the Hilltop next week, we've been thinking about the legacy of mentorship that exists among the faculty at Hackley.…
data.text:
"Education is not the filling of a pail, but the lighting of a fire." - William Butler Yeats This #WaterfordWisdomWednesday, let's ignite the fire of curiosity and lifelong learning with Waterford! ❤️🔥 As we navigate the changing seasons, both in nature and in education, the need for adaptability becomes clear. Embracing flexibility can build resilience in our learners. Let’s work together to adapt to the changing learning landscape and reach all children. Learn more by visiting our website, link in bio! #Curiosity #LifelongLearning #AdaptabilityInEducation

Wondering if pre-nursery is just about learning letters and numbers? Think again! Oakridge International Schools unlock the hidden magic of early education, fostering social skills, creativity, and a love for learning through play. Here's a sneak peek: → Building Confidence Through Playful Interactions → Sparking Curiosity & Early Math Concepts (Counting steps during tag, anyone?) → Laying the Foundation for a Lifelong Love of Reading Explore our latest blog post and learn more about Oakridge's nurturing programs! #EarlyChildhoodEducation #PreNursery #OakridgeSchools #ParentingTips

The Turtle Rescuers! Check out this article on experiential learning in action by Jean Wallace and Carly Stasa in our latest issue. “It seems simple, but when students are able to relate school learning to real-life issues, academics and classroom dynamics improve: students are more focused and motivated as they clearly see a purpose to their learning.” #experientiallearning #educationalmagazine #greenteacher #environmentaleducation #seaturtles

Forest schools are redefining #EarlyYearsEducation, offering a holistic approach rooted in nature. 🌳 What makes this educational trend stand out? Let's explore its key principles. 🌿 Child-led Learning: Instead of a fixed curriculum, forest schools trust children's innate curiosity, letting them explore and learn at their pace. Benefits: Personal Growth: Children gain confidence, resilience, and problem-solving skills. 🌟 Fueling Curiosity: The forest becomes a playground for questions, discoveries, and a love for learning. 🔍🍃 🍂 Regular Outdoor Sessions: Beyond occasional field trips, children embrace nature in all seasons, fostering deep connections. Benefits: Nature Bonding: They understand ecosystems and develop a respect for the environment. 🦋🌲 Holistic Development: Varied terrains boost motor skills, stamina, and adaptability. 🚶♂️🌧️ 🌲 Safety in Exploration: With freedom comes responsibility. Trained educators ensure risk assessments are thorough for safe adventures. Benefits: Risk Intelligence: Facing challenges like tree climbing, kids become adept at navigating potential dangers. 🌳 Empowerment: Trust in their decisions fosters self-esteem. 💪 The #ForestSchool approach crafts education with freedom, responsibility, and exploration. It aims to nurture well-rounded, environmentally-conscious learners, ready to embrace the future with zest and wonder. 🌍📚🌿 Read our full guide on our website: https://buff.ly/455xvWl 🔗

A seed cannot grow if there are no nutrients in the soil. Analogously, students can only begin to be curious if the conditions are right. By building relationships and centering student participation, teachers can create a community where curiosity and inquiry are valued. Dive into my latest blog post to see how to guide students to ask great questions by creating a safe environment for wondering: https://lnkd.in/g9VbT_Ni #LeadingWithQuestions

From the ECS Blog: Director of Student Experience, Ms. Lecuyer, highlights the benefits of co-curriculars for students. "School plays such an integral role in more ways than one! Beyond academics, it’s essential to provide opportunities to grow outside of the classroom." Read more: https://lnkd.in/eJaFrgfm
